Everyone's just going to pass over how the Artic was incorrectly referred to as the Antarctic throughout the video? Artic has the bears. Antarctic has penguins. "Artic" means "bear" in Latin. "Antarctic" means "no bear" in Latin. While both cold and snowy, the two ecosystems developed entirely independent of one another, and the only animals they share crossed the entire world, usually over several generations, and can also be found between the two.

You'd probably be better off, as a human, to use many multiple looseish layers of cling wrap to make a coat or parka. Otherwise, since you can't layer/delayer, you could overheat. Also the gaps, holes, leaks, etc. But since your circulatory system isn't evolved to deal with all this, it isn't great. Also, plastic isn't a great outer layer for a useful suit - you'd want to use waterproof hide or something like one - a drysuit would probably do it.

My Mom once dated a dude whose uncle was a "mountain man" up in Wyoming/Montana. He lived in a cabin without electricity, so at the start of every winter, he'd slather his whole body with lard and put on a pair of long underwear that pretty much stayed on until spring thaw. I imagine that by the end of 4-5 months it would be pretty rank, but he said it kept his body skin incredibly soft and smooth, so that he had a face, neck and hand skin that looked like they were chapped leather while everything else looked fresh as a teenager.
